Detailed Description

Class containing data needed to transform data with rotating, scaling and translating.

Mostly for transforming lat/lon into screen coordinates. <br /> Consists of the following transformation: t*R*S*T where T moves the coordinates to origo, S scales, R rotates and t moves the coordinates back into the screen.

Definition at line 37 of file TransformMatrix.h.

Member Typedef Documentation

typedef int32 TransformMatrix::scaleInt_t
 

Type of integer to use for scales.

It may be possible that 32 bits are faster that 16 on thumb.

virtual void TransformMatrix::matrixUpdated (   )  [inline, protected, virtual]
 

Method that is called in updateMatrix so that subclasses can update their internal state when that happens.

(E.g. for every move,zoom etc)

void TransformMatrix::setInternalCosLat (  double  cosLat  )

UpdateMatrix must be called before setInternalCosLat.

Definition at line 472 of file TransformMatrix.h.

References getCosLat(), MC2Coordinate::lat, and transformPointCosLatSupplied().

Referenced by inverseTranformCosLatSupplied(), and inverseTranformUsingCosLat().

void TransformMatrix::updateMatrix (  double  angle360,
double  scale,
const MC2Coordinate &  center,
int  screenWidth,
int  screenHeight
) 
 

Sets the data in the internal structure.

Specialised for lat/lon->screen. cosLat is set to the cosine of the center latitude.

Parameters:
angle360 Angle in degrees 0-359.999.
scale The scale in pixels per mc2 units.
topLeft The top-left corner of the screen.
screenWidth Width of the screen.
screenHeight Height of the screen.
